meanings.definition: To wrongly give or bestow an award.
meanings.sent1: The judge will misaward the trophy to the wrong contestant.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misaward the certificate to the incorrect student.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a misaward if the gold medal went to the last-place finisher.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to misaward the prize caused quite a stir in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's mistake led her to misaward the scholarship to the wrong student.

meanings.definition: An award that has been wrongly given or bestowed.
meanings.sent1: The misaward of the trophy was a disappointment to the rightful winner.
meanings.sent2: He proudly displayed the misaward on his shelf, unaware of the error.
meanings.sent3: The misaward of the blue ribbon to the cat instead of the dog was a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The misaward of the title made him feel like an imposter in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The misaward of the prize left a bitter taste in the recipient's mouth.
